definitions.definition: to give food to a person or an animal
definitions.sensetop: feed somebody/something/yourselffeed somebody/something sthfeed somebody/something (on) somethingfeed something to somebody/somethingfeed somebody/something with something

examples.text: Have you fed the cat yet?
The baby can't feed itself yet *(= can't put food into its own mouth)*.
It's important to feed children a well-balanced diet.
He has to be fed liquids through a tube in his stomach.
The cattle are fed (on) barley.
The barley is fed to the cattle.
The animals are fed with hay and grass.
Most of the crop is fed to the cattle.
She fed the children on baked beans and fish fingers.
Feed the kids and make sure they're in bed by nine.
Slugs and snails feed at night.
Egrets and a solitary grey heron were busily feeding.
The bears feed voraciously in summer and store energy as fat.

definitions.definition: to provide food for a person or group of people

examples.text: They have a large family to feed.
There's enough here to feed an army.
Have they been feeding you well?
They struggled to **feed and clothe** the children.
Having another mouth *(= person)* to feed can be a strain.
I can no longer afford to feed my family.
How can we feed a hungry world?
The children were poorly fed.
My grandmother always feeds me well.
She could barely feed and clothe herself.

definitions.definition: to give a plant a special substance to make it grow

examples.text: Feed the plants once a week.

definitions.definition: to give advice, information, etc. to somebody/something
definitions.sensetop: be fed somethingbe fed with somethingbe fed to somebody

examples.text: We are constantly fed gossip and speculation by the media.
The media were being fed with accusations and lies.
Gossip and speculation are constantly fed to us by the media.

definitions.sensetop: be fed (by something)A is fed with BB is fed into A

examples.text: The lake is fed by a river.
The electricity line is fed with power through an underground cable.
Power is fed into the electricity line through an underground cable.

definitions.definition: to put or push something into or through a machine
definitions.sensetop: feed A (with B)feed B into Afeed something into/through something

examples.text: He fed the meter with coins.
He fed coins into the meter.
The information was fed into the data store.
The fabric is fed through the machine.
Receptors constantly feed information into the system.
This feeds the paper through to the printer.
The data is fed directly into a computer.

definitions.definition: to satisfy a need, desire, etc. and keep it strong

examples.text: For drug addicts, the need to feed the addiction takes priority over everything else.

definitions.definition: to harm somebody who has helped you or supported you
to eat a lot of food or too much food

wordOrigin: Old English fēdan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch voeden and food.
